articles.description: Follow live text updates and BBC radio commentary from the County Championship as Surrey and Essex go for title.

articles.description: Arrests and reported incidents of disorder at football matches in England and Wales last season reached a new high.

articles.description: Patrick Reed sees his $750m defamation lawsuits against golf reporters and media outlets dismissed by a federal judge in Florida.

articles.description: It is 30 years since the United States last won a Ryder Cup contest in Europe. As the two sides face each other in Rome, BBC Sport looks back at Europe's dominance over their past six home meetings.
articles.title: Relive Europe's Ryder Cup home dominance

articles.description: Two years after being thrashed by the US at Whistling Straits a new-look Europe have their opportunity for redemption in Rome in the 44th Ryder Cup.
articles.title: Europe's chance of Ryder Cup redemption against US

articles.description: How growing up on a farm with three rugby-playing brothers helped Sam Whitelock to the verge of becoming New Zealand's most-capped player.
articles.title: Farm life to record-breaking All Black family

articles.description: Championship title-holders Jersey Reds "ceased trading" on Wednesday and say liquidation is "inevitable" unless funding can be found.
articles.title: Championship holders Jersey Reds 'cease trading'

articles.description: BBC Sport takes a look back at some of the most iconic volleys in Premier League history, featuring Alan Shearer, Robin van Persie and Gareth Bale.
articles.title: From Van Persie to Bale - watch greatest Premier League volleys

articles.description: World champion Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez says he is the animal to beat "lion" Jermell Charlo on Saturday in Las Vegas.
articles.title: Alvarez determined to prove doubter Charlo wrong
